New Records: Freddie Freeman became the first player in World Series history to hit a walk-off grand slam
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the tenth inning
Gerrit Cole pitched six innings with four hits and one earned run
Giancarlo Stanton hit a home run in the sixth inning to give the Yankees a 2-1 lead
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers and Yankees each held the best records in their respective leagues this season
Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Carlos Rodon will face off in Game Two of the World Series
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone declined the lefty on lefty matchup, which led to Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went to extra innings for the 63rd time in World Series history
The Dodgers won their fifth World Series game in walk-off fashion
Others: Freddie Freeman's sprained ankle did not seem to affect his performance
Jack Flaherty had a great performance except for one mistake to Stanton
